qas.question: What major interstate provides access between New Haven and New York City?
What major interstate in New Haven provides access northward into Massachusetts, Vermont, and eventually reaches the Canadian border?
Over which New Haven river does 1-95 cross on the east side?
What is the nickname given to the Pearl Harbor Memorial?
Which New Haven interstate is less congested throughout times designated as peak travel?
New Haven is adjacent to what part of the national highway?
Which of the nearby highway would take you north to Massachusetts?
Interstate 95 is also infamous for what exactly?
What river crosses path with I-95?
Is I-91 similar to I-95 in terms of bad traffic?

context: New Haven lies at the intersection of <a0_0><a5_0>Interstate 95<a5_0/><a0_0/> on the coast—which provides access southwards and/or westwards to the western coast of Connecticut and to New York City, and eastwards to the eastern Connecticut shoreline, Rhode Island, and eastern Massachusetts—and <a1_0><a6_0>Interstate 91<a6_0/><a1_0/>, which leads northward to the interior of Massachusetts and Vermont and the Canadian border. I-95 is infamous for <a7_0>traffic jams<a7_0/> increasing with proximity to New York City; on the east side of New Haven it passes over the <a2_0><a8_0>Quinnipiac River<a8_0/><a2_0/> via the Pearl Harbor Memorial, or <a3_0>"Q Bridge"<a3_0/>, which often presents a major bottleneck to traffic. <a4_0>I-91<a4_0/>, however, <a9_0>is relatively less congested<a9_0/>, except at the intersection with I-95 during peak travel times.
